enWisdom: Truthfulness is a means [of attaining success], Forgiveness is a virtue
Truthfulness is an elevation
The truthful one is honoured and dignified
Truthfulness is the life of God-wariness
Truth is the soul of speech
Truthfulness is the most successful evidence
Truthfulness is the perfection of nobility
Truth is the uprightness of everything

Wisdom: إِنَّ الصَّادِقَ لَمُكْرَمٌ جَلِيلٌ وَإِنَّ الْكَاذِبَ لَمُهَانٌ ذَلِيلٌ
enWisdom: Verily the truthful one is honoured and dignified, and indeed the liar is abased and humiliated
Through truthfulness, magnanimity becomes complete
By honesty and loyalty, magnanimity becomes complete for its possessor

Wisdom: عَلَيْكَ بِالصِّدْقِ فَمَنْ صَدَقَ فِي أَقْوَالِهِ جَلَّ قَدْرُهُ
enWisdom: Adopt truthfulness, for whoever is truthful in his speech, his status is elevated
Set your tongue aright and you will be secure
Be truthful and you will become loyal
For [the speaker of] truth there is benefit

Wisdom: لِيَكُنْ أَوْثَقُ النَّاسِ لَدَيْكَ أَنْطَقَهُمْ بِالصِّدْقِ
enWisdom: Let the most trustworthy of people in your estimation be the one who is most truthful in his speech

Wisdom: لَوْ تَمَيَّزَتِ الْأَشْيَاءُ لَكَانَ الصِّدْقُ مَعَ الشَّجَاعَةِ وَكَانَ الْجُبْنُ مَعَ الْكَذِبِ
enWisdom: If things were to be differentiated from each other, honesty would be with courage and cowardice would be with dishonesty

Wisdom: مَنْ كَانَ صَدُوقاً لَمْ يَعْدَمِ الْكَرَامَةَ [السَّلَامَةَ]
enWisdom: One who is always truthful will not be deprived of honour
One whose speech is truthful, his loftiness is increased
One whose language is truthful, his proof becomes strong
Whoever is known for his truthfulness, his lies are [also] accepted
One whose language is truthful, his proof becomes strong
There is no report better than the truth
He who argues with [the support of] truth is not defeated

Wisdom: يَبْلُغُ الصَّادِقُ بِصِدْقِهِ مَا لَا يَبْلُغُهُ الْكَاذِبُ بِاحْتِيَالِهِ
enWisdom: The truthful one achieves with his honesty what the liar cannot achieve with his deception

Wisdom: يَكْتَسِبُ الصَّادِقُ بِصِدْقِهِ ثَلَاثاً حُسْنَ الثِّقَةِ بِهِ وَالْمَحَبَّةَ لَهُ وَالْمَهَابَةَ عَنْهُ
enWisdom: The truthful one earns three things with his honesty: the virtue of being considered reliable, becoming beloved and being revered
